results.title: Batik
results.brief_description: A history of the Indian and Indonesian art and a demonstration by Nancy Belfer. Shows modern and traditional pieces being made. We see washing, drying and framing the cloth, the initial blocking-in of shapes, working with heated wax, the tjanting tool and the tjap, with a sequence on the actual printing and dyeing of the cloth. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Bathtime
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, John Bird, David Atkinson and Peter Madden
results.brief_description: A humourous claymation where a woman after waking in the morning takes a bath going through her morning cleansing ritual before work. The partner only later wakes up to find the woman missing.

results.title: Bathing the patient (home care)
results.creator_credit: Ted Nemeth Studios, United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids, F.E. Brooker and Marian Evans
results.brief_description: A guide to the home care of that maimed and injured loved one, recently returned from that dust-up in the Pacific. Solemn tone betrays not the least sympathy for the invalided one. In the absence of emotion, the domestic environment becomes a place of chilling austerity. Dutiful wife seeming resigned to her fate as resentful attendant. Frightening for its utilitarian ommissions. United States Office of Education training film for use in the instruction of professional nurses.

results.title: Bathing beauty
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and George Sidney
results.brief_description: A romantic musical comedy set in a girls college, mainly around the swimming pool, where the beautiful Esther Williams plays the role of a swimming instructor and Red Skelton stars as her lovesick, abandoned husband. A perfect setting for some stunning choreographed underwater performances by Esther Williams. Cast also includes Basil Rathbone, Bill Goodwin, Xavier Cugat, Ethel Smith, and featuring Harry James and his Orchestra.

results.title: Bate's car: sweet as a nut
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Rubbo, Colin Low and Tony Ianzelo
results.brief_description: A delightful film encounter with a man who found his own substitute for gasoline in barnyard manure. Mr. Bate is an inventor, a classic combination of single-minded knowhow and practical dreamer. But his discovery is real enough. The film shows how his homemade digester does turn manure into potent methane gas to power his auto. And for good measure he demonstrates his latest energy machine - a bicycle powered by the bumps on the road. Award: Yugoslavia.

results.title: Bataille du Rail
results.brief_description:
A reconstruction of the resistance work, including sabotage of the railway link between the Occupied and the Free Zones by French railmen during World War II. Clement brought the stark realism of his documentary shorts to bear on his first feature, a peaan to the courage of the railway workers, with the men themselves re-enacting their actual exploits. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide. Awards: Cannes Film Festival (1956): Best film, best director.

Credits: Director, Rene Clement ; writers, Rene Clement, Colette Audry ; photography, Henri Alekan ; music, Yves Baudrier.
Cast: Barnault, Clarieux, Daurand, Desagneux.

results.title: Bass on titles
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films and Saul Bass Films
results.brief_description: This film features American film producer Saul Bass discussing the evolution of title sequences that he has designed for feature films. He demonstrates how he translates the themes of major motion pictures into graphic visual animation. Sequences from films include: ‘The Man with the golden arm’, ‘West side story’, ‘It’s a mad, mad, mad world’ and ‘Walk on the wild side’, among others. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basquiat
results.creator_credit: Eleventh Street Productions, Jon Kilik, Sigurjon Sighvatsson, Randy Ostrow and Julian Schnabel
results.brief_description: Basquiat chronicles the rise to artistic stardom of Jean Michel Basquiat, who in 1981, catapulted from being an unknown graffiti writer to one of the most successful and controversial artists in New York. Embraced by Andy Warhol, Basquiat degenerated into the party lifestyle and heavy drug use, never ceasing to detest the rich who, in his mind, did not really accept him for who or what he was. Cast includes Jeffrey Wright, Benicio del Toro, Michael Wincott, Claire Forlani, Dennis Hopper, David Bowie, Gary Oldman and Courtney Love.

results.title: Basketry
results.brief_description: This film examines basketmaking techniques from around the world, demonstrates the two principal techniques used in basketmaking and shows how both modern and traditional materials can be used. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball techniques for girls
results.brief_description: This film gives a clear demonstration and explanation of basic skills: Basic movement skills; running, starting, stopping, turning, passing, finger control, movement with the pass, leading the receiver, choice of right pass, shooting, finger control, arm extension wrist flip, choice of the right shot, dribbling, faking and pivoting. No other credits available.
